posts.content:
**CISA** buries the lede in their cybersecurity alert about Citrix NetScaler
ADC and NetScaler Gateway, by not mentioning that CVE-2023-6548 and
CVE-2023-6549 are **exploited zero-days**. See the KEV Catalog announcement
that this toot is a reply to.  
🔗 [https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/18/citrix-releases-
security-updates-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-
gateway](https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/18/citrix-releases-
security-updates-netscaler-adc-and-netscaler-gateway)  
["Exploits of these CVEs on unmitigated appliances have been
observed."](https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX584986/netscaler-adc-and-
netscaler-gateway-security-bulletin-for-cve20236548-and-cve20236549)

posts.content:
**Citrix** security advisory contains two **zero-days** : Two vulnerabilities
have been discovered in NetScaler ADC (formerly Citrix ADC) and NetScaler
Gateway (formerly Citrix Gateway):

  * CVE-2023-6548 (5.5 medium) Authenticated (low privileged) remote code execution on Management Interface

account.note: Current open-source cyber threat intelligence, critical vulnerabilities, zero-days, proofs of concept, cybercrime/cyberespionage, threat actors/APTs, IOCs, and other cybersecurity and intelligence news.

posts.content:
CISA put a 1 week deadline on CVE-2023-6548 whereas CVE-2023-6549 and
CVE-2024-0519 have a 3 week deadline. This is likely because CVE- 2023- 6548
only impacts the management interface, and the management interface should NOT
be exposed to the internet in the first place.

CVE-2023-6548.description: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection') in NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway allows an attacker with access to NSIP, CLIP or SNIP with management interface to perform Authenticated (low privileged) remote code execution on Management Interface.

posts.content:
CISA put a 1 week deadline on CVE-2023-6548 whereas CVE-2023-6549 and
CVE-2024-0519 have a 3 week deadline. This is likely because CVE- 2023- 6548
only impacts the management interface, and the management interface should NOT
be exposed to the internet in the first place.

posts.content:
**Microsoft** MSRC published three security advisories:

  * [CVE-2024-0517](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-0517)Chromium: CVE-2024-0517 Out of bounds write in V8
  * [CVE-2024-0518](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-0518) Chromium: CVE-2024-0518 Type Confusion in V8
  * [CVE-2024-0519](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-0519) Chromium: CVE-2024-0519 Out of bounds memory access in V8

Note: _"Google is aware of reports that an exploit for CVE-2024-0519 exists in
the wild."_ Google marked these vulnerabilities as high severity.

posts.content:
CISA put a 1 week deadline on CVE-2023-6548 whereas CVE-2023-6549 and
CVE-2024-0519 have a 3 week deadline. This is likely because CVE- 2023- 6548
only impacts the management interface, and the management interface should NOT
be exposed to the internet in the first place.

posts.content:
"⚠️ Alert: Androxgh0st Botnet Targets AWS & Microsoft Credentials! 🚨"

The cybersecurity realm is on high alert with the emergence of Androxgh0st, a
botnet malware exploiting vulnerabilities to steal AWS and Microsoft
credentials. It's a Python-scripted threat, targeting sensitive .env files and
leveraging SMTP for credential scanning and web shell deployment. Key
vulnerabilities exploited include CVE-2017-9841, CVE-2018-15133, and
CVE-2021-41773, allowing remote code execution and file uploads. This critical
development warrants immediate attention and proactive defense strategies.

Tags: [#CyberSecurity](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CyberSecurity)
[#Botnet](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Botnet)
[#Androxgh0st](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Androxgh0st)
[#Vulnerability](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Vulnerability)
[#AWS](https://infosec.exchange/tags/AWS)
[#Microsoft](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Microsoft)
[#SMTP](https://infosec.exchange/tags/SMTP)
[#PHP](https://infosec.exchange/tags/PHP)
[#CVE20179841](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE20179841)
[#CVE201815133](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE201815133)
[#CVE202141773](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202141773)
[#RemoteCodeExecution](https://infosec.exchange/tags/RemoteCodeExecution)
[#CyberAttack](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CyberAttack)

Sources:

  * "Androxgh0st Botnet Malware Steals AWS, Microsoft Credentials" by Tushar Subhra Dutta on GBHackers. [https://gbhackers.com/androxgh0st-botnet-malware/](https://gbhackers.com/androxgh0st-botnet-malware/)
  * "US Gov Issues Warning for Androxgh0st Malware Attacks" by Ionut Arghire on SecurityWeek. [https://www.securityweek.com/us-gov-issues-warning-for-androxgh0st-malware-attacks/](https://www.securityweek.com/us-gov-issues-warning-for-androxgh0st-malware-attacks/)

[Mitre - CVE-2017-9841](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-9841)  
[Mitre - CVE-2018-15133](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-15133)  
[Mitre - CVE-2021-41773](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-41773)

posts.content:
Vulnerabilities mentioned in this CISA cybersecurity advisory:

  * CVE-2017-9841 (9.8 critical, disclosed 27 June 2017, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 February 2022) arbitrary PHP code execution in PHPUnit
  * CVE-2018-15133 (8.1 high, disclosed 09 August 2018, added to KEV 16 January 2024) Laravel Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability (RCE)
  * CVE-2021-41773 (7.5 high, disclosed 05 October 2021, added to KEV 03 November 2021) Apache HTTP Server Path Traversal Vulnerability (RCE)

CVE-2018-15133.description: In Laravel Framework through 5.5.40 and 5.6.x through 5.6.29, remote code execution might occur as a result of an unserialize call on a potentially untrusted X-XSRF-TOKEN value. This involves the decrypt method in Illuminate/Encryption/Encrypter.php and PendingBroadcast in gadgetchains/Laravel/RCE/3/chain.php in phpggc. The attacker must know the application key, which normally would never occur, but could happen if the attacker previously had privileged access or successfully accomplished a previous attack.

posts.content:
"⚠️ Alert: Androxgh0st Botnet Targets AWS & Microsoft Credentials! 🚨"

The cybersecurity realm is on high alert with the emergence of Androxgh0st, a
botnet malware exploiting vulnerabilities to steal AWS and Microsoft
credentials. It's a Python-scripted threat, targeting sensitive .env files and
leveraging SMTP for credential scanning and web shell deployment. Key
vulnerabilities exploited include CVE-2017-9841, CVE-2018-15133, and
CVE-2021-41773, allowing remote code execution and file uploads. This critical
development warrants immediate attention and proactive defense strategies.

CVE-2021-41773.description: A flaw was found in a change made to path normalization in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.49. An attacker could use a path traversal attack to map URLs to files outside the directories configured by Alias-like directives. If files outside of these directories are not protected by the usual default configuration "require all denied", these requests can succeed. If CGI scripts are also enabled for these aliased pathes, this could allow for remote code execution. This issue is known to be exploited in the wild. This issue only affects Apache 2.4.49 and not earlier versions. The fix in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.50 was found to be incomplete, see CVE-2021-42013.

posts.content:
"🚨 Ivanti VPN Zero-Day Exploits Unleash Global Cyber Onslaught 🚨"

🔒 Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy
Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation.
Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities
enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide,
including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to
backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply
vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool.
All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid
these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are
notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains
targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and
Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and
Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network
traffic and supports various malicious activities.

Stay vigilant and prioritize immediate protective actions!

🔗 Source: [BleepingComputer - Sergiu
Gatlan](https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/ivanti-connect-secure-
zero-days-now-under-mass-exploitation/)

posts.content:
**Volexity** reports the following about CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887:

  * Exploitation of these vulnerabilities is now widespread. Volexity has been able to find evidence of compromise of over 1,700 devices worldwide.
  * Additional threat actors beyond UTA0178 appear to now have access to the exploit and are actively trying to exploit devices.

🔗 [https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-
exploitation-goes-global/](https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-
connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/)

posts.content:
Nouveau post de Volexity qui  
continue l'analyses des attaques en cours et mets en lumière une observation
importante pour la correcte application de la mitigation.

⚠️ Attention à la réimportation des backups dans l'appliance  
⬇️ ‼️  
Plusieurs organisations, après avoir déployé une nouvelle appliance VPN Ivanti
et appliqué le XML de mitigation, ont subi une nouvelle compromission.  
⬇️  
Cela est dû au fait qu'elles ont importé des fichiers de configuration de
sauvegarde après avoir appliqué la mitigation, annulant ainsi cette dernière.
Volexity souligne l'importance d'appliquer la mitigation après l'importation
de toute configuration de sauvegarde pour éviter une nouvelle compromission de
l'appareil.  
👇  
[https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/18/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-
exploitation-new-
observations/](https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/18/ivanti-connect-secure-
vpn-exploitation-new-observations/)

posts.content:
🚨 Comme annoncé par les même chercheurs à l'origine de la découverte initiale,
l'exploitation de vulnérabilités dans
[#Ivanti](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Ivanti) Connect Secure VPN est devenue
généralisée, impliquant des acteurs de menaces opportunistes au-delà du groupe
UTA0178.  
👇  
[https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-
exploitation-goes-global/](https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-
connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/)

Ces vulnérabilités sont désormais et en ce moment même exploitées en masse (❗
) contre les instances Ivanti exposées sur Internet qui n'ont pas encore
appliqué le XML de mitigation proposé  
⚠️ 🩹 👇  
[https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-
CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-
Secure-Gateways?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-
CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-
Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US)

Selon ces chercheurs il y aurait actuellement plus de 1 700 appareils
compromis à travers le monde.

En image, le nombre d'instances encore vulnérables (❗ ) et exposées sur
Internet en Europe selon le moteur de recherche&indexation Shadowserver

Pour les administrateurs de ces systèmes, il est devenu essentiel d'appliquer
immédiatement le fichier de mitigation recommandé. Il est également crucial de
procéder à une vérification approfondie de l'intégrité de ces systèmes en
utilisant le logiciel mis à disposition.  
👇  
[https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB44755?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB44755?language=en_US)

Si une compromission avérée de l'intégrité du système est détectée, ou en
présence de comptes inconnus ou anomalies dans les logs, il est alors opportun
d'envisager une réinstallation de l'appliance Ivanti. Cette démarche est
essentielle pour prévenir de manière efficace toute intrusion d’hôtes
indésirables & malintentionnés sur les réseaux internes concernées...

\---- Timeline (selon Velexity) ----

03-12-2023 | Première exploitation observée par Volexity.

10-01-2024 | Volexity rapporte les détails de l'exploitation observée de
CVE-2024-21887 & CVE-2023-46805.

11-01-2024 | Volexity découvre des preuves que UTA0178 tente une exploitation
de masse.

11-01-2024 | Mandiant rapporte ses propres observations.

15-01-2024 | Volexity divulgue des preuves d'exploitation massive et la
compromission présumée d'au moins 1700 dispositifs ICS.

[#CyberVeille](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CyberVeille)
[#Ivanti](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Ivanti)
[#CVE_2023_46805](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE_2023_46805)

posts.content:
Since [#Ivanti](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Ivanti) hasn't released a patch
yet for the [#pulsesecure](https://infosec.exchange/tags/pulsesecure)
[#vpn](https://infosec.exchange/tags/vpn) CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887, I
have made a nuclei template for scanning whether or not their mitigation XML
file has been applied:

[https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-
templates/pull/8936](https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-
templates/pull/8936)

Thanks to [@watchtowrcyber](https://bird.makeup/users/watchtowrcyber) (come
on, get a real mastodon account!) for their reverse engineering research to
make this possible ([https://labs.watchtowr.com/welcome-to-2024-the-sslvpn-
chaos-continues-ivanti-
cve-2023-46805-cve-2024-21887/](https://labs.watchtowr.com/welcome-

The mitigation for the Ivanti ICS/IPS
[#ConnectAround](https://infosec.exchange/tags/ConnectAround) bug is some XML

Gateways?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-

If someone has a copy of that file can you send it to me to have a look?

The actual patch for the bug will be "staggered" across the next few weeks
where exploitation by CN APTs will inevitably be much, much faster

posts.content:
**Ivanti** zero-days: Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS), formerly known as Pulse
Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways. _"If CVE-2024-21887 is used
in conjunction with CVE-2023-46805, exploitation does not require
authentication and enables a threat actor to craft malicious requests and
execute arbitrary commands on the system."_

  * CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) authentication bypass
  * CVE-2024-21887 ( **9.1 critical** ) command injection

🔗

  * security advisory: [https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US)
  * blog post: [https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways](https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways)

posts.content:
**Ivanti** zero-days: Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS), formerly known as Pulse
Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways. _"If CVE-2024-21887 is used
in conjunction with CVE-2023-46805, exploitation does not require
authentication and enables a threat actor to craft malicious requests and
execute arbitrary commands on the system."_

  * CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) authentication bypass
  * CVE-2024-21887 ( **9.1 critical** ) command injection

🔗

  * security advisory: [https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US)
  * blog post: [https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways](https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways)
  * knowledge base article: [https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US)

People are calling them **exploited zero-days.** There is no patch available
at this time:
[https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/111732557100241084](https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/111732557100241084)

EDIT: **Are you aware of any active exploitation of the vulnerability?**  
 _We are aware of less than 10 customers impacted by the vulnerabilities. We
are unable to discuss the specifics of our customers._

posts.content:
"🚨 Ivanti VPN Zero-Day Exploits Unleash Global Cyber Onslaught 🚨"

🔒 Two zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti's Connect Secure VPN and Policy
Secure network access control (NAC) appliances are facing mass exploitation.
Discovered by Volexity, the CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887 vulnerabilities
enable widespread attacks, impacting businesses of all sizes worldwide,
including Fortune 500 companies. The GIFTEDVISITOR webshell variant is used to
backdoor systems, indicating a serious threat level.

Ivanti hasn't released patches yet. Administrators are advised to apply
vendor-provided mitigation measures and use Ivanti's Integrity Checker Tool.
All data on compromised ICS VPN appliances should be considered at risk. Amid
these attacks, suspected Chinese state-backed actors (UTA0178 or UNC5221) are
notably active, with Mandiant identifying five custom malware strains
targeting breached systems.

These include Zipline Passive Backdoor, Thinspool Dropper, Wirefire and
Lightwire web shells, Warpwire harvester, PySoxy tunneler, BusyBox, and
Thinspool utility. Particularly alarming is Zipline, which intercepts network
traffic and supports various malicious activities.

Stay vigilant and prioritize immediate protective actions!

🔗 Source: [BleepingComputer - Sergiu
Gatlan](https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/ivanti-connect-secure-
zero-days-now-under-mass-exploitation/)

posts.content:
🚨 Comme annoncé par les même chercheurs à l'origine de la découverte initiale,
l'exploitation de vulnérabilités dans
[#Ivanti](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Ivanti) Connect Secure VPN est devenue
généralisée, impliquant des acteurs de menaces opportunistes au-delà du groupe
UTA0178.  
👇  
[https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-
exploitation-goes-global/](https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-
connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/)

Ces vulnérabilités sont désormais et en ce moment même exploitées en masse (❗
) contre les instances Ivanti exposées sur Internet qui n'ont pas encore
appliqué le XML de mitigation proposé  
⚠️ 🩹 👇  
[https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-
CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-
Secure-Gateways?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-
CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-
Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US)

Selon ces chercheurs il y aurait actuellement plus de 1 700 appareils
compromis à travers le monde.

En image, le nombre d'instances encore vulnérables (❗ ) et exposées sur
Internet en Europe selon le moteur de recherche&indexation Shadowserver

Pour les administrateurs de ces systèmes, il est devenu essentiel d'appliquer
immédiatement le fichier de mitigation recommandé. Il est également crucial de
procéder à une vérification approfondie de l'intégrité de ces systèmes en
utilisant le logiciel mis à disposition.  
👇  
[https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB44755?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB44755?language=en_US)

Si une compromission avérée de l'intégrité du système est détectée, ou en
présence de comptes inconnus ou anomalies dans les logs, il est alors opportun
d'envisager une réinstallation de l'appliance Ivanti. Cette démarche est
essentielle pour prévenir de manière efficace toute intrusion d’hôtes
indésirables & malintentionnés sur les réseaux internes concernées...

\---- Timeline (selon Velexity) ----

03-12-2023 | Première exploitation observée par Volexity.

10-01-2024 | Volexity rapporte les détails de l'exploitation observée de
CVE-2024-21887 & CVE-2023-46805.

11-01-2024 | Volexity découvre des preuves que UTA0178 tente une exploitation
de masse.

11-01-2024 | Mandiant rapporte ses propres observations.

15-01-2024 | Volexity divulgue des preuves d'exploitation massive et la
compromission présumée d'au moins 1700 dispositifs ICS.

[#CyberVeille](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CyberVeille)
[#Ivanti](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Ivanti)
[#CVE_2023_46805](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE_2023_46805)

posts.content:
Since [#Ivanti](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Ivanti) hasn't released a patch
yet for the [#pulsesecure](https://infosec.exchange/tags/pulsesecure)
[#vpn](https://infosec.exchange/tags/vpn) CVE-2023-46805 & CVE-2024-21887, I
have made a nuclei template for scanning whether or not their mitigation XML
file has been applied:

[https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-
templates/pull/8936](https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-
templates/pull/8936)

Thanks to [@watchtowrcyber](https://bird.makeup/users/watchtowrcyber) (come
on, get a real mastodon account!) for their reverse engineering research to
make this possible ([https://labs.watchtowr.com/welcome-to-2024-the-sslvpn-
chaos-continues-ivanti-
cve-2023-46805-cve-2024-21887/](https://labs.watchtowr.com/welcome-
to-2024-the-sslvpn-chaos-continues-ivanti-cve-2023-46805-cve-2024-21887/))

posts.content:
**Mandiant** published their own blog post regarding the active exploitation
of Ivanti zero-days CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887. They track the threat
actor UTA0178 (Volexity's) as **UNC5221** , described as a suspected APT. They
describe post-exploitation activity and identify custom malware. IOC and Yara
rules provided.  
🔗 [https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/suspected-apt-targets-ivanti-zero-
day](https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/suspected-apt-targets-ivanti-

posts.content:
**Ivanti** zero-days: Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS), formerly known as Pulse
Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways. _"If CVE-2024-21887 is used
in conjunction with CVE-2023-46805, exploitation does not require
authentication and enables a threat actor to craft malicious requests and
execute arbitrary commands on the system."_

  * CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) authentication bypass
  * CVE-2024-21887 ( **9.1 critical** ) command injection

🔗

  * security advisory: [https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US)
  * blog post: [https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways](https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways)
  * knowledge base article: [https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US)

People are calling them **exploited zero-days.** There is no patch available
at this time:
[https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/111732557100241084](https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/111732557100241084)

EDIT: **Are you aware of any active exploitation of the vulnerability?**  
 _We are aware of less than 10 customers impacted by the vulnerabilities. We
are unable to discuss the specifics of our customers._

Here is a public advisory for

posts.content:
🚨 Comme annoncé par les même chercheurs à l'origine de la découverte initiale,
l'exploitation de vulnérabilités dans
[#Ivanti](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Ivanti) Connect Secure VPN est devenue
généralisée, impliquant des acteurs de menaces opportunistes au-delà du groupe
UTA0178.  
👇  
[https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-connect-secure-vpn-
exploitation-goes-global/](https://www.volexity.com/blog/2024/01/15/ivanti-
connect-secure-vpn-exploitation-goes-global/)

Ces vulnérabilités sont désormais et en ce moment même exploitées en masse (❗
) contre les instances Ivanti exposées sur Internet qui n'ont pas encore
appliqué le XML de mitigation proposé  
⚠️ 🩹 👇  
[https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-
CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-
Secure-Gateways?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-
CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-
Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US)

Selon ces chercheurs il y aurait actuellement plus de 1 700 appareils
compromis à travers le monde.

En image, le nombre d'instances encore vulnérables (❗ ) et exposées sur
Internet en Europe selon le moteur de recherche&indexation Shadowserver

Pour les administrateurs de ces systèmes, il est devenu essentiel d'appliquer
immédiatement le fichier de mitigation recommandé. Il est également crucial de
procéder à une vérification approfondie de l'intégrité de ces systèmes en
utilisant le logiciel mis à disposition.  
👇  
[https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB44755?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB44755?language=en_US)

Si une compromission avérée de l'intégrité du système est détectée, ou en
présence de comptes inconnus ou anomalies dans les logs, il est alors opportun
d'envisager une réinstallation de l'appliance Ivanti. Cette démarche est
essentielle pour prévenir de manière efficace toute intrusion d’hôtes
indésirables & malintentionnés sur les réseaux internes concernées...

\---- Timeline (selon Velexity) ----

03-12-2023 | Première exploitation observée par Volexity.

10-01-2024 | Volexity rapporte les détails de l'exploitation observée de
CVE-2024-21887 & CVE-2023-46805.

11-01-2024 | Volexity découvre des preuves que UTA0178 tente une exploitation
de masse.

11-01-2024 | Mandiant rapporte ses propres observations.

15-01-2024 | Volexity divulgue des preuves d'exploitation massive et la
compromission présumée d'au moins 1700 dispositifs ICS.

[#CyberVeille](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CyberVeille)
[#Ivanti](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Ivanti)
[#CVE_2023_46805](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE_2023_46805)

posts.content:
**Ivanti** zero-days: Ivanti Connect Secure (ICS), formerly known as Pulse
Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways. _"If CVE-2024-21887 is used
in conjunction with CVE-2023-46805, exploitation does not require
authentication and enables a threat actor to craft malicious requests and
execute arbitrary commands on the system."_

  * CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) authentication bypass
  * CVE-2024-21887 ( **9.1 critical** ) command injection

🔗

  * security advisory: [https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US)
  * blog post: [https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways](https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-ivanti-policy-secure-gateways)
  * knowledge base article: [https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US](https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-CVE-2023-46805-Authentication-Bypass-CVE-2024-21887-Command-Injection-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US)

People are calling them **exploited zero-days.** There is no patch available
at this time:
[https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/111732557100241084](https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/111732557100241084)

are unable to discuss the specifics of our customers._

posts.content:
"🚨 Windows 10 Update Woes: The 0x80070643 Error Conundrum 🚨"

Microsoft is urgently addressing the 0x80070643 error disrupting Windows 10
updates. The culprit? A flawed KB5034441 security update patching
CVE-2024-20666, a critical BitLocker vulnerability. This error surfaces on
systems with insufficient Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) partition
space, misleadingly signaling an installation failure. 🔒💻

As a remedy, Microsoft has released a PowerShell script to automate the WinRE
update, crucial for rectifying the BitLocker bypass issue. This proactive
measure aims to shield against potential exploits targeting encrypted data.
⚔️🔐

Author: Sergiu Gatlan
[Source](https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-working-on-
a-fix-for-windows-10-0x80070643-errors/)

account.note:
Infosec, dark music, dark fashion, Atari, cats, and intrested in much more.

he/him

Posting a mixture of infosec stuff, phishing mails, music, cats and whatever else comes to my mind.

posts.content:
So, [#microsoft](https://infosec.exchange/tags/microsoft)
[#patches](https://infosec.exchange/tags/patches) KB5034122 and KB5034123
(Bitlocker encryption vuln CVE-2024-20666) are crapping out on what seems
random systems due to an issue with a too small recovery partition.

The solution so far 'resize the recovery partition' is not a solution at
schale.

Look, I know writing patches is not easy, but if you are Microsoft, there is
no excuse for this.

[#edit](https://infosec.exchange/tags/edit): on further reading: just another
reason to always enable PIN when you deploy bitlocker:

If TPM+PIN BitLocker  
protectors are being used, can the vulnerability be exploited if the attacker
does not know the TPM PIN?

No. To exploit the vulnerability the attacker needs to know the TPM PIN if the
user is protected by the BitLocker TPM+PIN.

posts.content:
"Cagada" de [#Microsoft](https://mastodon.social/tags/Microsoft) al desplegar
en Windows10 el KB5034441 para solucionar la vulnerabilidad
[https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-
guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20666](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-
guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20666). El parche no se instala por falta de
espacio en la partición de recuperación (que M$ crea por defecto con
aproximadamente 500MB al instalar). M$ ha publicado un procedimiento para
solucionarlo que implica aumentar manualmente el tamaño de la partición en 250
MB.  
[https://www.tomshardware.com/software/windows/microsoft-
kb5034441-windows-10-security-patch-for-bitlocker-bypass-is-leading-to-errors-
and-has-a-complicated-
fix](https://www.tomshardware.com/software/windows/microsoft-
kb5034441-windows-10-security-patch-for-bitlocker-bypass-is-leading-to-errors-
and-has-a-complicated-fix)

account.note: Small biz IT support/consulting in Chicago's NW burbs; software dev before that; BA-CS before that. Tries to make tech understandable and not overwhelming for clients. Desperately in need of a haircut. Known associate of felines. Probably ascended once in Nethack many years ago.

posts.content:
I have to admit, my immediate thoughts on the Bitlocker/WinRE vulnerability
(local access required) were:  
1) Oh hey, recovery without TPM sniffing  
2) Reasons why you need to be able to remote-clear the TPM on managed remote
devices (e.g. remote user laptops).  
3) Reasons why Bitlocker alone isn't enough for situations where security is
required vs security theater. Threat models matter.

CVE: [https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-
guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20666](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-
guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20666) "BitLocker Security Feature Bypass
Vulnerability"

posts.content:
Avis de sécurité CVE-2023-22527

Atlassian annonce une vulnérabilité critique d'exécution de code à distance
(RCE) dans les versions obsolètes de Confluence Data Center et Confluence
Server. Les versions affectées comprennent les séries 8.0.x à 8.4.x et 8.5.0 à
8.5.3, publiées avant le 5 décembre 2023.

Atlassian recommande de mettre à jour immédiatement vers la version la plus
récente pour corriger cette faille de sécurité (évaluée avec une criticité de
10 !) et se protéger contre d'autres vulnérabilités non critiques mentionnées
dans le bulletin de sécurité de janvier d'Atlassian.  
👇  
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/security/cve-2023-22527-rce-remote-code-
execution-vulnerability-in-confluence-data-center-and-confluence-
server-1333990257.html](https://confluence.atlassian.com/security/cve-2023-22527-rce-
remote-code-execution-vulnerability-in-confluence-data-center-and-confluence-
server-1333990257.html)

CVE-2023-22527.description:
A template injection vulnerability on older versions of Confluence Data Center and Server allows an unauthenticated attacker to achieve RCE on an affected instance. Customers using an affected version must take immediate action.

Most recent supported versions of Confluence Data Center and Server are not affected by this vulnerability as it was ultimately mitigated during regular version updates. However, Atlassian recommends that customers take care to install the latest version to protect their instances from non-critical vulnerabilities outlined in Atlassian’s January Security Bulletin.

posts.content:
**VulnCheck** wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  * 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  * The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  * The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

🔗 [https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-
intel-7777-botnet](https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet)

posts.content:
**VulnCheck** wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  * 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  * The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  * The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

CVE-2022-45460.description: Multiple Xiongmai NVR devices, including MBD6304T V4.02.R11.00000117.10001.131900.00000 and NBD6808T-PL V4.02.R11.C7431119.12001.130000.00000, allow an unauthenticated and remote user to exploit a stack-based buffer overflow and crash the web server, resulting in a system reboot. An unauthenticated and remote attacker can execute arbitrary code by sending a crafted HTTP request that triggers the overflow condition via a long URI passed to a sprintf call. NOTE: this is different than CVE-2018-10088, but this may overlap CVE-2017-16725.

CVE-2022-24355.description: This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of TP-Link TL-WR940N 3.20.1 Build 200316 Rel.34392n (5553) routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of file name extensions. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. Was ZDI-CAN-13910.

posts.content:
So this is the non-dislosed, no-exploit-detected, "worst" of the bunch this
month: [msrc.microsoft.com/update-
guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20674](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-
guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20674)

> An unauthenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by establishing
> a machine-in-the-middle (MITM) attack or other local network spoofing
> technique, then sending a malicious Kerberos message to the client victim
> machine to spoof itself as the Kerberos authentication server.

Trying to think through this one.

posts.content:
I had too much free time and produced a list of what Microsoft considered
"Exploitation More Likely" (their version of Exploit Prediction Scoring System
(EPSS)):

  * [CVE-2024-20674](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20674) (9.0 critical): Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-21318](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-21318) (8.8 high): Microsoft SharePoint Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-20683](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20683) (7.8 high): Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-20698](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20698) (7.8 high): Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-20653](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20653) (7.8 high): Microsoft Common Log File System Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-20686](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20686) (7.8 high): Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-21310](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-21310) (7.8 high): Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-21307](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-21307) (7.5 high): Remote Desktop Client Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-20652](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-20652) (7.5 high): Windows HTML Platforms Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

Again, not publicly disclosed or exploited.

posts.content:
"⚠️ Alert: Androxgh0st Botnet Targets AWS & Microsoft Credentials! 🚨"

The cybersecurity realm is on high alert with the emergence of Androxgh0st, a
botnet malware exploiting vulnerabilities to steal AWS and Microsoft
credentials. It's a Python-scripted threat, targeting sensitive .env files and
leveraging SMTP for credential scanning and web shell deployment. Key
vulnerabilities exploited include CVE-2017-9841, CVE-2018-15133, and
CVE-2021-41773, allowing remote code execution and file uploads. This critical
development warrants immediate attention and proactive defense strategies.

CVE-2017-9841.description: Util/PHP/eval-stdin.php in PHPUnit before 4.8.28 and 5.x before 5.6.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via HTTP POST data beginning with a "<?php " substring, as demonstrated by an attack on a site with an exposed /vendor folder, i.e., external access to the /vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Util/PHP/eval-stdin.php URI.

posts.content:
"⚠️ CVE-2023-36025: A Stepping Stone in Phemedrone Stealer Attacks"

Trend Micro's recent investigation reveals the exploitation of CVE-2023-36025,
a Windows Defender SmartScreen bypass, in the Phemedrone Stealer campaign.
This vulnerability allows attackers to evade defense by using .url files to
download malicious .cpl scripts unnoticed. Phemedrone Stealer, an open-source
malware maintained on GitHub and Telegram, targets web browsers,
cryptocurrency wallets, and messaging apps like Telegram and Steam, harvesting
sensitive data and system information. Notably, CVE-2023-36025 was patched by
Microsoft in Nov 2023, but remains on CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities
list due to its active exploitation.

The attack involves hosting malicious Internet Shortcut files on platforms
like Discord, often disguised using URL shorteners. Upon execution, these
files download a .cpl file, bypassing the usual security prompts. This
leverages the MITRE ATT&CK technique T1218.002, using control.exe to run .cpl
files. The subsequent stages involve a PowerShell loader hosted on GitHub, and
a second-stage loader known as Donut, which executes the final payload in
memory. This sophisticated attack sequence showcases the complexity and
stealth of modern cyber threats.

Phemedrone's payload is versatile, targeting various applications for
sensitive information like passwords, files, and system data. It uses advanced
techniques for data handling and compression, highlighting the need for
vigilant cybersecurity practices.

Tags: [#CyberSecurity](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CyberSecurity)
[#CVE202336025](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202336025)
[#PhemedroneStealer](https://infosec.exchange/tags/PhemedroneStealer)
[#DefenseEvasion](https://infosec.exchange/tags/DefenseEvasion)

posts.content:
Hackers Weaponize [#Windows](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Windows) Flaw to
Deploy Crypto-Siphoning Phemedrone Stealer

Note: This vulnerability (CVE-2023-36025) is now patched as of NOV 2023. So
hopefully you've updated your Windows device(s) since November 2023 Patch
Tuesday.

Also, this campaign is yet another that abuses Discord's CDN by hosting the
malware. The [#malware](https://infosec.exchange/tags/malware) executes a
control panel file in a way that bypasses
[#Defender](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Defender) SmartScreen. Paves the way
for loading information stealer "Phemedrone"

Trend Micro's Peter Girnus, Aliakbar Zahravi & Simon Zuckerbraun delve into
the Phemedrone Stealer campaign's exploitation of CVE-2023-36025, the Windows

defense-evasion-in-phemedrone-
steal.html](https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/a/cve-2023-36025-exploited-

account.note: Current open-source cyber threat intelligence, critical vulnerabilities, zero-days, proofs of concept, cybercrime/cyberespionage, threat actors/APTs, IOCs, and other cybersecurity and intelligence news.

posts.content:
**Trend Micro** uncovered evidence pointing to an active exploitation of
CVE-2023-36025 (8.8 high, exploited as a zero-day with public disclosure,
disclosed by Microsoft in 14 November 2023 Patch Tuesday) to infect users with
a previously unknown strain of the malware, Phemedrone Stealer. Phemedrone
targets web browsers and data from cryptocurrency wallets and messaging apps
such as Telegram, Steam, and Discord. It also takes screenshots and gathers
system information regarding hardware, location, and operating system details.
The stolen data is then sent to the attackers via Telegram or their C2 server.
This open-source stealer is written in C# and actively maintained on GitHub
and Telegram. TTPs and payload analysis described. IOC provided.  
🔗 [https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/a/cve-2023-36025-exploited-
for-defense-evasion-in-phemedrone-
steal.html](https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/a/cve-2023-36025-exploited-
for-defense-evasion-in-phemedrone-steal.html)

posts.content:
Hackers Weaponize [#Windows](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Windows) Flaw to
Deploy Crypto-Siphoning Phemedrone Stealer

Note: This vulnerability (CVE-2023-36025) is now patched as of NOV 2023. So
hopefully you've updated your Windows device(s) since November 2023 Patch
Tuesday.

Also, this campaign is yet another that abuses Discord's CDN by hosting the
malware. The [#malware](https://infosec.exchange/tags/malware) executes a
control panel file in a way that bypasses
[#Defender](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Defender) SmartScreen. Paves the way
for loading information stealer "Phemedrone"

CVE-2023-36846.description:
A Missing Authentication for Critical Function vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS on SRX Series allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause limited impact to the file system integrity.



With a specific request to user.php that doesn't require authentication an attacker is able to upload arbitrary files via J-Web, leading to a loss of 

integrity

for a certain 

part of the file system, which may allow chaining to other vulnerabilities.


This issue affects Juniper Networks Junos OS on SRX Series:



  *  All versions prior to 20.4R3-S8;
  *  21.1 versions 21.1R1 and later;
  *  21.2 versions prior to 21.2R3-S6;
  *  21.3 versions 

prior to 

 21.3R3-S5;
  *  21.4 versions 

prior to 

21.4R3-S5;
  *  22.1 versions 

prior to 

22.1R3-S3;
  *  22.2 versions 

prior to 

22.2R3-S2;
  *  22.3 versions 

prior to 

22.3R2-S2, 22.3R3;
  *  22.4 versions 

prior to 

22.4R2-S1, 22.4R3.

posts.content:
There's currently no public reference suggesting that CVE-2023-35082 was being
exploited, so CISA may have received inside information from an affected
organization. For more information on how CVE-2023-35082 relates to the
previously disclosed Ivanti EPMM zero-days see the following excerpt:  
_"Since CVE-2023-35082 arises from the same place as CVE-2023-35078,
specifically the permissive nature of certain entries in the_ `mifs` _web
application’s security filter chain, Rapid7 would consider this new
vulnerability a patch bypass for CVE-2023-35078."_  
Discovered by **Rapid7** :
[https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-core-
unauthenticated-api-access-
vulnerability/](https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/02/cve-2023-35082-mobileiron-
core-unauthenticated-api-access-vulnerability/)

posts.content:
Honestly, I'm surprised that CVE-2023-38203 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog 6
months later. [@catc0n](https://infosec.exchange/@catc0n) of Rapid7 alerted
the community to zero-day exploitation using Project Discovery's
CVE-2023-38203 technical details and proof of concept exploit around 17 July:
[https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/07/17/etr-active-exploitation-of-
multiple-adobe-coldfusion-
vulnerabilities/](https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/07/17/etr-active-
exploitation-of-multiple-adobe-coldfusion-vulnerabilities/)

Then again, that was a wild week/month. Patch Tuesday had Microsoft disclosing
6 actively exploited zero-days; Apple had the WebKit zero-day CVE-2023-37450.
This was followed the next week with Citrix CVE-2023-3519, and Ivanti EPMM
CVE-2023-35078. [#CveCrowdDeny](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CveCrowdDeny)

posts.content:
I published my simple PoC for CVE-2022-44729 Atlassian Jira SSRF due to Apache
Batik vulnerabilites.

[https://psytester.github.io/Jira_SSRF_at_Batik_CVEs_PoC/](https://psytester.github.io/Jira_SSRF_at_Batik_CVEs_PoC/)

CVE-2022-44729.description:
Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Apache Software Foundation Apache XML Graphics Batik.This issue affects Apache XML Graphics Batik: 1.16.

On version 1.16, a malicious SVG could trigger loading external resources by default, causing resource consumption or in some cases even information disclosure. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.17 or later.

posts.content:
**VulnCheck** wrote about 7777-Botnet with the following information:

  * 7777-Botnet remains active, and VulnCheck used co-located services to theorize the botnet is infecting TP-Link, Xiongmai, and Hikvision devices using CVE-2017-7577, CVE-2018-10088, CVE-2022-45460, CVE-2021-36260, and/or CVE-2022-24355.
  * The botnet also appears to infect other systems like MVPower, Zyxel NAS, and GitLab, although at a very low volume.
  * The botnet doesn’t just start a service on port 7777. It also spins up a SOCKS5 server on port 11228.

🔗 [https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-
intel-7777-botnet](https://vulncheck.com/blog/ip-intel-7777-botnet)

posts.content:
**SOCRadar** emphasizes the criticality of Cisco Unity Connection
Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability. While CVE-2024-20272 has
a CVSSv3 score of 7.3 and high severity, you should read carefully into the
description in the security advisory: _"An attacker could exploit this
vulnerability by uploading arbitrary files to an affected system. A successful
exploit could allow the attacker to store malicious files on the system,
execute arbitrary commands on the operating system, and elevate privileges to_
**root."** This is one reason why you should not rely on just CVSSv3 scores
alone.  
🔗 [https://socradar.io/high-severity-vulnerability-in-cisco-unity-connection-
could-enable-root-privileges-cve-2024-20272/](https://socradar.io/high-
severity-vulnerability-in-cisco-unity-connection-could-enable-root-privileges-
cve-2024-20272/)

posts.content:
**Cisco** coming in a day late for Patch Tuesday with the following 7
advisories:

  * [CVE-2024-20251](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-ISE-XSS-bL4VTML) (4.8 medium): Cisco Identity Services Engine Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2023-20248, CVE-2023-20249](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-tms-portal-xss-AXNeVg3s) (5.4 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  * [CVE-2024-20277](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-thouseyes-privesc-DmzHG3Qv) (6.8 medium): Cisco ThousandEyes Enterprise Agent Virtual Appliance Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-20287](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-sb-wap-inject-bHStWgXO) (6.5 medium severity): Cisco WAP371 Wireless Access Point Command Injection Vulnerability
    * NOTE: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is aware that **proof-of-concept** exploit code is available for the vulnerability described in this advisory
  * [Multiple CVE IDs](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-pi-epnm-wkZJeyeq) (6.5 medium): Cisco Evolved Programmable Network Manager and Cisco Prime Infrastructure Vulnerabilities
  * [CVE-2024-20272](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cuc-unauth-afu-FROYsCsD) (7.3 high): Cisco Unity Connection Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-20270](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-broadworks-xss-6syj82Ju) (4.8 medium): Cisco BroadWorks Application Delivery Platform and Xtended Services Platform Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20287 has PoC, making it a zero-day.

CVE-2024-20272.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Unity Connection could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to upload arbitrary files to an affected system and execute commands on the underlying operating system. This vulnerability is due to a lack of authentication in a specific API and improper validation of user-supplied data. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by uploading arbitrary files to an affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to store malicious files on the system, execute arbitrary commands on the operating system, and elevate privileges to root.

ich das alles falsch verstehe, aber so sieht mein trister Blick auf die
Realität aktuell aus.)
[https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2021-3620](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2021-3620)

CVE-2021-3620.description: A flaw was found in Ansible Engine's ansible-connection module, where sensitive information such as the Ansible user credentials is disclosed by default in the traceback error message. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality.

posts.content:
We have the first vendor product actually vulnerable to that Apache Struts
vuln from December 2023 - CVE-2023-50164.

Product: Trackplus Allegra  
Tailored POC:
[https://srcincite.io/pocs/src-2024-0001.py.txt](https://srcincite.io/pocs/src-2024-0001.py.txt)  
Advisory:
[https://srcincite.io/advisories/src-2024-0001/](https://srcincite.io/advisories/src-2024-0001/)

Complete with ../.. directory traversal too.

Disclosure Timeline:

2023-11-08 – Vulnerability reported to security@struts.apache.org

2023-12-21 – Silently patched by the vendor

Shodan search: title:"Allegra" html:"trackplus"

account.note: Current open-source cyber threat intelligence, critical vulnerabilities, zero-days, proofs of concept, cybercrime/cyberespionage, threat actors/APTs, IOCs, and other cybersecurity and intelligence news.

posts.content:

CVE-2023-50164.description:
An attacker can manipulate file upload params to enable paths traversal and under some circumstances this can lead to uploading a malicious file which can be used to perform Remote Code Execution.
Users are recommended to upgrade to versions Struts 2.5.33 or Struts 6.3.0.2 or greater to fix this issue.

posts.content:
>>  
修正された脆弱性の内、パスワードリセット機能における脆弱性（CVE-2023-7028）が悪用された場合、任意のユーザーアカウントのパスワードが第三者によりリセットされ、多要素認証を有効にしていない環境ではアカウントの乗っ取りに繋がる可能性があります。なお、同脆弱性の実証コード（PoC）と見られる情報が既に公開されています。

影響を受けるバージョンを利用している場合は、GitLabが提供する情報を参考に、対策や調査を実施いただくことを推奨します。脆弱性を悪用する攻撃の被害を受けた可能性があるかどうかログを調査する方法がGitLabから公開されています。  
<<  
[https://www.jpcert.or.jp/newsflash/2024011601.html](https://www.jpcert.or.jp/newsflash/2024011601.html)

基本的にはまず自分だけでもいいので多要素認証をとにかく有効にしたうえで、作業時間を早めにとってGithubのバージョンアップをすることかな、と思った。

posts.content:
So, in case anyone still thinks that patching and security in general is not
so important nowadays: Found already several tries of exploiting the recent
critical CVE-2023-7028 vulnerability in the logs of my GitLab instance
although it was only published a few days ago.

Conclusion:  
✅ Install security updates *literally* ASAP.  
✅ Turn on mandatory 2FA for all users.

[#GitLab](https://infosec.exchange/tags/GitLab)
[#cve](https://infosec.exchange/tags/cve) unauthenticated password reset
account takeover (CVSS 10.0) CVE-2023-7028

Very simple to exploit, attacker can receive the password reset email for any
known user with any email address.

PoC is public and available. Please patch ASAP. You are not affected if you've
enforced MFA for all users (as they will be able to reset password but can't
login).

posts.content:
The [#GitLab](https://infosec.exchange/tags/GitLab)
[#vulnerability](https://infosec.exchange/tags/vulnerability) allowing trivial
account hijacking (CVE-2023-7028) will lead to ton of problems: It will allow
malicious actors to perform
[#supplychain](https://infosec.exchange/tags/supplychain)
[#attacks](https://infosec.exchange/tags/attacks) \- something that will allow
attacker to gain access to 3rd party who don't themselves run GitLab but just
include from projects that do. I would suggest great caution regardless if you
run GitLab yourself or not.

Naturally anyone using GitLab themselves must update as soon as possible. I
would also suggest performing forensic investigation to find out if you have
already been compromised, and take further action in case compromise has
already occurred. Check "Were any accounts actually compromised due to this
vulnerability?" section in this post for details:
[https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/01/11/critical-security-release-
gitlab-16-7-2-released/](https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/01/11/critical-
security-release-gitlab-16-7-2-released/)

posts.content:
[#GitLab](https://infosec.exchange/tags/GitLab)
[#cve](https://infosec.exchange/tags/cve) unauthenticated password reset
account takeover (CVSS 10.0) CVE-2023-7028

Very simple to exploit, attacker can receive the password reset email for any
known user with any email address.

PoC is public and available. Please patch ASAP. You are not affected if you've
enforced MFA for all users (as they will be able to reset password but can't
login).

posts.content:
The [#GitLab](https://infosec.exchange/tags/GitLab)
[#vulnerability](https://infosec.exchange/tags/vulnerability) allowing trivial
account hijacking (CVE-2023-7028) will lead to ton of problems: It will allow
malicious actors to perform
[#supplychain](https://infosec.exchange/tags/supplychain)
[#attacks](https://infosec.exchange/tags/attacks) \- something that will allow
attacker to gain access to 3rd party who don't themselves run GitLab but just
include from projects that do. I would suggest great caution regardless if you
run GitLab yourself or not.

Naturally anyone using GitLab themselves must update as soon as possible. I
would also suggest performing forensic investigation to find out if you have
already been compromised, and take further action in case compromise has
already occurred. Check "Were any accounts actually compromised due to this
vulnerability?" section in this post for details:
[https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/01/11/critical-security-release-
gitlab-16-7-2-released/](https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/01/11/critical-
security-release-gitlab-16-7-2-released/)

posts.content:
PSA: Update your GitLab instances to version 16.7.2, 16.6.4, or 16.5.6!

Critical (CVSS 10/10) vulnerability allows account takeover without user
interaction via password reset. CVE-2023-7028

There are some other critical/high vulns as well:

[https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/01/11/critical-security-release-
gitlab-16-7-2-released/#account-takeover-via-password-reset-without-user-
interactions](https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/01/11/critical-security-
release-gitlab-16-7-2-released/#account-takeover-via-password-reset-without-
user-interactions)

[#gitlab](https://mstdn.io/tags/gitlab)
[#infosec](https://mstdn.io/tags/infosec)
[#security](https://mstdn.io/tags/security)
[#CVE_2023_7028](https://mstdn.io/tags/CVE_2023_7028)

CVE-2023-7028.description: An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 16.1 prior to 16.1.6, 16.2 prior to 16.2.9, 16.3 prior to 16.3.7, 16.4 prior to 16.4.5, 16.5 prior to 16.5.6, 16.6 prior to 16.6.4, and 16.7 prior to 16.7.2 in which user account password reset emails could be delivered to an unverified email address.

posts.content:
[@mttaggart](https://infosec.town/@mttaggart) CVE-2023-45230, CVE-2023-45234
and CVE-2023-45235 are buffer overflows. The first one is straight forward. We
have not provided exploits, just ways of reproducing the vulns. Writing a
exploit would be doing it tailored to the specific targets but note UEFI
firmware does not have any exploit mitigations. Depending what you consider
"successful exploitation" YMMV.

posts.content:
CISA says that threat actors are exploiting a vulnerability in Microsoft
SharePoint servers.

Tracked as CVE-2023-29357, the bug was patched in June of last year.

The vulnerability is an elevation of privilege that can be chained with other
SharePoint bugs to achieve remote code execution attacks.

Loads of technical write-ups and public PoCs on how to perform such attacks
have been available online since September of last year.

[https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/10/cisa-adds-one-known-
exploited-vulnerability-catalog](https://www.cisa.gov/news-
events/alerts/2024/01/10/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog)

posts.content:
CISA says that threat actors are exploiting a vulnerability in Microsoft
SharePoint servers.

Tracked as CVE-2023-29357, the bug was patched in June of last year.

The vulnerability is an elevation of privilege that can be chained with other
SharePoint bugs to achieve remote code execution attacks.

Loads of technical write-ups and public PoCs on how to perform such attacks
have been available online since September of last year.

[https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/01/10/cisa-adds-one-known-
exploited-vulnerability-catalog](https://www.cisa.gov/news-
events/alerts/2024/01/10/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog)

posts.content:
**Juniper** security advisory: Junos OS: SRX Series and EX Series:
CVE-2024-21591 ( **9.8 critical** , disclosed 10 January 2024) preAuth Remote
Code Execution vulnerability in J-web  
"An Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in J-Web of Juniper Networks Junos OS
SRX Series and EX Series allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to
cause a Denial of Service (DoS), or Remote Code Execution (RCE) and obtain
root privileges on the device. This issue is caused by use of an insecure
function allowing an attacker to overwrite arbitrary memory. Juniper SIRT is
not aware of any malicious exploitation of this vulnerability."  
🔗 [https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/2024-01-Security-Bulletin-
Junos-OS-SRX-Series-and-EX-Series-Security-Vulnerability-in-J-web-allows-a-
preAuth-Remote-Code-Execution-
CVE-2024-21591?language=en_US](https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/2024-01-Security-
Bulletin-Junos-OS-SRX-Series-and-EX-Series-Security-Vulnerability-in-J-web-
allows-a-preAuth-Remote-Code-Execution-CVE-2024-21591?language=en_US)

account.note:
>> INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY RESEARCH LABS ⚡🔍🛡️

KR. Laboratories (kr-labs.com.ua) — це об'єднання IT-професіоналів, які досліджують та популяризують інформаційні технології в Україні.

На цьому сервері Mastodon ми:
├─ Публікуємо свої думки та ідеї, авторські колонки, нотатки, записки, дослідження, розслідування, опитування на різні теми, що стосуються технологій, і не тільки.
├─ Ділимося громадянською позицією, новинами, аналітикою та експертною думкою щодо подій в Україні (та за її межами). Факти, інсайди, ремарки.

Теми:

- Інфо-/кібербезпека
- Операційна безпека
- Національна безпека
- Юридична безпека
- Економічна безпека

Теґи:

#tech #cyber #security #research #ukraine #cybersecurity #infosec #webappsec #threatintel #intelligence #privacy #osint #investigations #nationalsecurity #economicsecurity #fintech #digitalsecurity #humansecurity #humanrights #geopolitics #sociology

~

Героям Слава!

posts.content:
Виявляється, що незадовго до "зламу століття", сервери Kyivstar мали відомі
вразливості.

Як показує кібер-пошукова аналітична система SHODAN, було мінімум 2 публічно
доступних RDP, вразливих до CVE-2020-0796 (SMBGhost - RCE).

Були також виявлені публічно доступні пристрої Cisco ASA SSL VPN. В минулому
подібні пристрої не раз ставали ціллю та об'єктами APT-атак, їх експлуатували
різноманітні Ransomware угрупування, про що йдеться тут:
[https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/29/under-siege-rapid7-observed-
exploitation-of-cisco-asa-ssl-
vpns/](https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/08/29/under-siege-
rapid7-observed-exploitation-of-cisco-asa-ssl-vpns/)

Дякуємо досліднику @whichbuffer за інсайд.

Подейкують, CISO Київстар вже у пошуках нових opportunity. І не дивно!

Як я вже неодноразово писав, на керівні посади Інформаційної безпеки в
українські компанії набирають різних некваліфікованих дармоїдів (менеджерів,
рекламщиків, піарщиків, бухгалтерів і т.д.), замість того щоб брати талановиту
та патріотично налаштовану молодь (власне, тому їх і переманюють іноземні
компанії).

[#kyivstar](https://infosec.exchange/tags/kyivstar)

CVE-2023-6027.description: A critical flaw has been identified in elijaa/phpmemcachedadmin affecting version 1.3.0, specifically related to a stored XSS vulnerability. This vulnerability allows malicious actors to insert a carefully crafted JavaScript payload. The issue arises from improper encoding of user-controlled entries in the "/pmcadmin/configure.php" parameter.

CVE-2023-39143.description: PaperCut NG and PaperCut MF before 22.1.3 on Windows allow path traversal, enabling attackers to upload, read, or delete arbitrary files. This leads to remote code execution when external device integration is enabled (a very common configuration).

account.note: Current open-source cyber threat intelligence, critical vulnerabilities, zero-days, proofs of concept, cybercrime/cyberespionage, threat actors/APTs, IOCs, and other cybersecurity and intelligence news.

posts.content:
Microsoft's MSRC released one more security advisory 4 hours after the others
hit my RSS feed:

  * [CVE-2024-20721](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-20721) Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2024-20721 Improper Input Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability

It's weird how they titled it but included _"Impact: Remote Code Execution"_.
This was marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less
Likely.

account.note: Current open-source cyber threat intelligence, critical vulnerabilities, zero-days, proofs of concept, cybercrime/cyberespionage, threat actors/APTs, IOCs, and other cybersecurity and intelligence news.

posts.content:
MSRC released one more security advisory 4 hours after the others hit my RSS
feed:

  * [CVE-2024-20721](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-20721) Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2024-20721 Improper Input Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability

It's weird how they titled it and also in included _"Impact: Remote Code
Execution"_. This was marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and
Exploitation Less Likely.

CVE-2024-20721.description: Acrobat Reader T5 (MSFT Edge) versions 120.0.2210.91 and earlier are affected by an Improper Input Validation vulnerability. An unauthenticated attacker could leverage this vulnerability to achieve an application denial-of-service in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

posts.content:
**Microsoft** MSRC updated with five* security advisories related to
Chromium. The unexpected part was all the additional information:

  * [CVE-2024-20709](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-20709) Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2024-20709 Javascript Implementation PDF Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-20675](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-20675) (6.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2023-48631](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2023-48631)Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2023-Improper Input Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-0333](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-0333) Chromium: CVE-2024-0333 Insufficient data validation in Extensions
  * [CVE-2024-21337](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-21337) (5.2 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20709, CVE-2024-20675, CVE-2023-48631, CVE-2024-21337 are marked Not
Publicly Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely.
CVE-2024-21337 was published 30 minutes later.

CVE-2017-5487, with a screenshot of my username in the public users endpoint 😂

CVE-2017-5487.description: wp-includes/rest-api/endpoints/class-wp-rest-users-controller.php in the REST API implementation in WordPress 4.7 before 4.7.1 does not properly restrict listings of post authors, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a wp-json/wp/v2/users request.

posts.content:
**Security Week** : China-Linked Volt Typhoon Hackers Possibly Targeting
Australian, UK Governments. Chinese state-sponsored hackers are targeting old
vulnerabilities in Cisco routers in new attacks apparently aimed at government
entities in the US, UK, and Australia, cybersecurity firm SecurityScorecard
reports. As part of the observed attacks, the adversaries exploited
CVE-2019-1653 and CVE-2019-1652, two critical-severity bugs in discontinued
Cisco small business RV320/325 VPN routers, which have been targeted by
Chinese hackers before and are also featured in CISA’s KEV catalog.  
🔗 [https://www.securityweek.com/china-linked-volt-typhoon-hackers-possibly-
targeting-australian-uk-governments/](https://www.securityweek.com/china-
linked-volt-typhoon-hackers-possibly-targeting-australian-uk-governments/)

CVE-2019-1652.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Small Business RV320 and RV325 Dual Gigabit WAN VPN Routers could allow an authenticated, remote attacker with administrative privileges on an affected device to execute arbitrary commands. The vulnerability is due to improper validation of user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious HTTP POST requests to the web-based management interface of an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying Linux shell as root. Cisco has released firmware updates that address this vulnerability.

CVE-2019-1653.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Small Business RV320 and RV325 Dual Gigabit WAN VPN Routers could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to retrieve sensitive information. The vulnerability is due to improper access controls for URLs. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by connecting to an affected device via HTTP or HTTPS and requesting specific URLs. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to download the router configuration or detailed diagnostic information. Cisco has released firmware updates that address this vulnerability.

posts.content:
Kind of annoyed that the security fix for the Magic Keyboard isn't included on
their "Apple security releases" page. I hope it's just an oversight.

It's not a major issue for most folks but I like it when authoritative sources
of security info are complete and comprehensive.

Magic Keyboard Firmware Update 2.0.6

> CVE-2024-0230: An attacker with physical access to the accessory may be able
> to extract its Bluetooth pairing key and monitor Bluetooth traffic

[https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT214050](https://support.apple.com/en-
us/HT214050)

Apple security releases page  
[https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201222](https://support.apple.com/en-
us/HT201222)

And it's still possible to have such TOCTOU races lurking elsewhere in a
filesystem API, so it's probably not specific to predicates:
[https://blog.rust-lang.org/2022/01/20/cve-2022-21658.html](https://blog.rust-
lang.org/2022/01/20/cve-2022-21658.html)

And races pop up in any software that has to perform filesystem operations:  
\-
[https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-2619.html](https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-2619.html)  
\-
[https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-20316.html](https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2021-20316.html)

CVE-2022-21658.description: Rust is a multi-paradigm, general-purpose programming language designed for performance and safety, especially safe concurrency. The Rust Security Response WG was notified that the `std::fs::remove_dir_all` standard library function is vulnerable a race condition enabling symlink following (CWE-363). An attacker could use this security issue to trick a privileged program into deleting files and directories the attacker couldn't otherwise access or delete. Rust 1.0.0 through Rust 1.58.0 is affected by this vulnerability with 1.58.1 containing a patch. Note that the following build targets don't have usable APIs to properly mitigate the attack, and are thus still vulnerable even with a patched toolchain: macOS before version 10.10 (Yosemite) and REDOX. We recommend everyone to update to Rust 1.58.1 as soon as possible, especially people developing programs expected to run in privileged contexts (including system daemons and setuid binaries), as those have the highest risk of being affected by this. Note that adding checks in your codebase before calling remove_dir_all will not mitigate the vulnerability, as they would also be vulnerable to race conditions like remove_dir_all itself. The existing mitigation is working as intended outside of race conditions.

CVE-2021-43566.description: All versions of Samba prior to 4.13.16 are vulnerable to a malicious client using an SMB1 or NFS race to allow a directory to be created in an area of the server file system not exported under the share definition. Note that SMB1 has to be enabled, or the share also available via NFS in order for this attack to succeed.

posts.content:
**Cisco** coming in a day late for Patch Tuesday with the following 7
advisories:

  * [CVE-2024-20251](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-ISE-XSS-bL4VTML) (4.8 medium): Cisco Identity Services Engine Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2023-20248, CVE-2023-20249](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-tms-portal-xss-AXNeVg3s) (5.4 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  * [CVE-2024-20277](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-thouseyes-privesc-DmzHG3Qv) (6.8 medium): Cisco ThousandEyes Enterprise Agent Virtual Appliance Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20287.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of the Cisco WAP371 Wireless-AC/N Dual Radio Access Point (AP) with Single Point Setup could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to perform command injection attacks against an affected device. This vulnerability is due to improper validation of user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted HTTP requests to the web-based management interface of an affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges on the device. To exploit this vulnerability, the attacker must have valid administrative credentials for the device.

CVE-2024-20270.description:
A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco BroadWorks Application Delivery Platform and Cisco BroadWorks Xtended Services Platform could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface.
 This vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user of the interface to click a crafted link. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the affected interface or access sensitive, browser-based information.

  * [CVE-2023-20248, CVE-2023-20249](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-tms-portal-xss-AXNeVg3s) (5.4 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
  * [CVE-2024-20277](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-thouseyes-privesc-DmzHG3Qv) (6.8 medium): Cisco ThousandEyes Enterprise Agent Virtual Appliance Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-20287](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-sb-wap-inject-bHStWgXO) (6.5 medium severity): Cisco WAP371 Wireless Access Point Command Injection Vulnerability
    * NOTE: The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is aware that **proof-of-concept** exploit code is available for the vulnerability described in this advisory
  * [Multiple CVE IDs](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-pi-epnm-wkZJeyeq) (6.5 medium): Cisco Evolved Programmable Network Manager and Cisco Prime Infrastructure Vulnerabilities
  * [CVE-2024-20272](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cuc-unauth-afu-FROYsCsD) (7.3 high): Cisco Unity Connection Unauthenticated Arbitrary File Upload Vulnerability
  * [CVE-2024-20270](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-broadworks-xss-6syj82Ju) (4.8 medium): Cisco BroadWorks Application Delivery Platform and Xtended Services Platform Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

CVE-2024-20287 has PoC, making it a zero-day.

CVE-2024-20251.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to perform a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface on an affected device. This vulnerability exists because the web-based management interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting malicious code into specific pages of the interface. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the affected interface or access sensitive, browser-based information.

CVE-2023-51448.description: Cacti provides an operational monitoring and fault management framework. Version 1.2.25 has a Blind SQL Injection (SQLi) vulnerability within the SNMP Notification Receivers feature in the file `‘managers.php’`. An authenticated attacker with the “Settings/Utilities” permission can send a crafted HTTP GET request to the endpoint `‘/cacti/managers.php’` with an SQLi payload in the `‘selected_graphs_array’` HTTP GET parameter. As of time of publication, no patched versions exist.

CVE-2022-1471.description: SnakeYaml's Constructor() class does not restrict types which can be instantiated during deserialization. Deserializing yaml content provided by an attacker can lead to remote code execution. We recommend using SnakeYaml's SafeConsturctor when parsing untrusted content to restrict deserialization. We recommend upgrading to version 2.0 and beyond.

posts.content:
For anyone using [#XWiki](https://infosec.exchange/tags/XWiki) \- please
quickly patch CVE-2024-21650 (Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution via
registration forms).

You can also disable registration, but unsure if this will completely mitigate
the vulnerability.

CVE-2024-21650.description: XWiki Platform is a generic wiki platform offering runtime services for applications built on top of it. XWiki is vulnerable to a remote code execution (RCE) attack through its user registration feature. This issue allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code by crafting malicious payloads in the "first name" or "last name" fields during user registration. This impacts all installations that have user registration enabled for guests. This vulnerability has been patched in XWiki 14.10.17, 15.5.3 and 15.8 RC1.
